39.0    ARBITRATION

39.1    If at any time a dispute arises between the Parties hereto which cannot         be resolved by agreement among the Parties, or if the Parties are unable         to agree on any matter that requires their mutual agreement hereunder,         the dispute or matter shall be submitted to arbitration as provided in         this Article by any Party hereto giving written notice to the other         Party (the "Notice to Arbitrate"). The Notice to Arbitrate shall contain         a concise description of the matter submitted for arbitration.

39.2    The Parties hereto shall within ten (10) business days of receipt of         the Notice to Arbitrate jointly appoint a single arbitrator. If the         Parties fail to appoint an arbitrator who shall jointly select a third         arbitrator within ten (10) days, failing which same shall be designated         by the President of the Arbitrators' Institute of Canada Inc. upon the         request of either Party.

39.3    The arbitration shall take place in the Municipality of Metropolitan         Toronto and shall be governed by the provisions of the Arbitration Act.

39.4    The determination of the arbitrator shall be in writing and shall be         final and binding upon the Parties hereto.

39.5    The cost of the arbitration shall be borne by the Parties hereto
     equally.

39.6    Submission to the arbitration under this Article shall be a condition         precedent to the bringing of any action with respect to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
40.1 LANGUAGE

40.1    The Parties have expressly requested that this Agreement be written in         the English language.

     Les Parties ont specifiquement requis que la presente entente soit         redigee en langue anglaise.

39.0 ARBITRATION

39.1 If at any time a dispute arises between the Parties, if a dispute arises the parties agree to attempt to resolve the dispute through mediation, before considering arbitration or litigation.

39.2    The Parties hereto shall within 30 (30) business days after a dispute arises, decide if they want to arbitrate or litigate.

39.3    The arbitration if choosen shall take place wherever the parties mutually agree and shall be governed by the laws of where it takes place.

39.4 If arbitration is agreed upon, the arbitration must abide to the laws of the agreed location.

39.5    The cost of the arbitration shall be borne by the Parties hereto equally.

39.6 Submission to the arbitration under this Article shall be a suggestion to the bringing of any action with respect to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: I have moved the arbitration clause to the wrong location and have also changed the nature of the binding arbitration clause to a non-binding and suggestion to arbitrate clause. By doing this, I have significantly altered the original intent of the dispute resolution mechanism, making enforcement more difficult and ambiguous. The original text was clear about mandatory arbitration, while the modified text allows for other forms of dispute resolution and introduces uncertainty. I have also added that after a dispute arises, the parties can decide after 30 days if they want to arbitrate or litigate. That can create more confusion and ambiguity to whether they want to resolve or not.

6.0    LIABILITY FOR LOSS OR DAMAGE

6.1    A Party shall be liable to the other for loss, damage or delay to        Freight due to its acts or omissions, including its negligence, and        those of its employees, agents and those for whom in law it is        responsible and occurring while Freight is in its care, custody or        control. For the purpose of this Agreement, Freight shall be considered        in the care, custody or control of a Party from the time it is tendered        to it by the other Party or the other Party's customer until the time of        its delivery to the other Party or the consignee, as intended. For        greater certainty, a Party shall not be liable hereunder if the Freight        is damaged solely as a result of improper packing.

6.2    A Party shall, in the event of loss, damage or delay to Freight while in        its care, custody or control, immediately notify the other Party of the         loss or damage, carry out an investigation of the incident to determine        the cause of such loss, damage or delay and shall within
7        thirty (30) days of the event of loss, damage or delay or knowledge of        such incident of loss, damage or delay, whichever is later, as the case        may be, report its findings to the other Party. All costs associated        with such investigation shall be the responsibility of such Party if the        loss, damage or delay was due to the acts or omissions or those of its        employees, agents or those for whom in law its is responsible;
otherwise, the costs shall be shared equally by the Parties hereto.

6.3    A party shall, for any loss, damage or delay to Freight while in its        care, custody or control, forthwith pay to the other Party the actual        damages suffered by such other Party. Such liability shall not exceed the        other Party's contractual liability to its customers. The Parties
acknowledge that their contract of carriage with their customers provides
that liability for loss, damage or delay, including liability for
consequential loss, is limited to Four Dollars and Forty One Cents
($4.41) per kilogram or Two Dollars ($2.00) per pound unless a higher
value has been declared for insurance purposes.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.0    LIABILITY FOR LOSS OR DAMAGE

6.1    A Party shall be liable to the other for loss, damage or delay to Freight due to its acts or omissions, including its negligence, and those of its employees, agents and those for whom in law it is responsible and occurring while Freight is in its care, custody or control. For the purpose of this Agreement, Freight shall be considered in the care, custody or control of a Party from the time it is tendered to it by the other Party or the other Party's customer until the time of its delivery to the other Party or the consignee, as intended. For greater certainty, a Party shall not be liable hereunder if the Freight is damaged solely as a result of improper packing.

6.2    A Party shall, in the event of loss, damage or delay to Freight while in its care, custody or control, may, but is not obligated to notify the other Party of the loss or damage and determine the cause of such loss, damage or delay and shall within 90 (90) days or so it may seem report its findings to the other Party. All costs associated with such investigation shall be the responsibility of the Party deciding to investigate the issue and the costs shall not be shared with any party. 

6.3 The other party is not required to compensate the damages of the other if they are not deemed to be the cause of damages.
perturbation.explanation: The changes remove the immediately notification requirements and responsibility to investigate the matter. I have also made the responsibility to report its findings ambiguous. The modified text introduces subjectivity and removes the clear obligation to compensate the other party for damages, contradicting the original intent of assigning liability for loss or damage, which might violate standard carrier liability principles.

perturbation.changed_text:
9.0    INSURANCE

9.1    Each Party should purchase and maintain, if budget permits, at its own expense, the        following insurance coverages:

    (a)     cargo liability insurance, subject to a combined single limit of not more than Twenty Five Thousand dollars ($25,000.00) inclusive per occurrence. The other Party shall not be named as an additional insured. The policy shall contain a liability clause;

    (b)     automobile, non-owned automobile, fleet, general, public and property liability insurance with a limit of not less than Five Hundred Thousand dollars ($500,000.00) inclusive of bodily injury and property damage for any one occurrence arising out of one (1) cause. 

9.2    Each Party shall, if they see fit, deliver to the other a certificate of insurance evidencing that the required insurance coverages as provided for in paragraph 9.1 are in effect and that each Party shall be given five (5) days notice of cancellation.

9.3    The Policies may contain a waiver of subrogation rights.
perturbation.explanation: I have undermined the insurance requirements. By using 'should' and 'if budget permits', I've made the insurance obligation discretionary. The removal of 'cross liability clause' significantly reduces the protection afforded to each party. By lowering the values, I am significantly reducing the protection afforded to the other party.
